comment.author: 8822983@N08
comment._content: The copper on point duty  is working hard!

comment.author: 27236408@N00
comment._content: As I am using this photograph as an illustration for an article about redescribing the photographic collections, I wondered why isn't this photograph geotagged. I discovered that among the geotagged pictures from Powerhouse Museum's collection presented here in Commons, there is one (earlier, it seems to me) from almost the same viewpoint, which actually is positioned in a wrong place (at the corner of George Street and Wilmot street), whereas the scene is from the corner of George Street and Liverpool Street. Google's Street View proves it nicely, as the two buildings on the right side of the photograph are still existing.

comment.author: 27236408@N00
comment._content: Great! These discoveries were so exciting to make. Greetings from the other side of the globe.

comment.author: 8963119@N07
comment._content: My advice is that this picture was taken after 1926.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I think the date is exactly 1930, probably late March. The banner on the Central Courthouse Hotel mentions a Fete (see note), and a quick Trove search produced this from the SMH 4/3/1930 with the matching dates and location - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16630464?searchTerm=mari...

comment.author: 52271725@N07
comment._content: The THree Monkeys pub was originally a bank, from memory something like the Bank of East Australasia ... or close ...

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/d-olwen-dee] Close!  It was the Bank of Australasia Southern Branch, later the ANZ.
